meanings.definition: Small or weak in size or power.
meanings.sent1: The puppy was puny compared to the big dog.
meanings.sent2: The puny flower struggled to grow in the harsh sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The puny squirrel tried to lift the acorn, but it was too heavy for him.
meanings.sent4: Her puny efforts to lift the heavy box were futile.
meanings.sent5: The puny candle flickered weakly in the dark room.

meanings.sent1: The puny sandcastle crumbled under the force of the waves.
meanings.sent2: His puny excuse for being late did not convince anyone.
meanings.sent3: The puny umbrella flipped inside out in the strong wind.
meanings.sent4: The puny argument fell apart under scrutiny.
meanings.sent5: Her puny attempt at a joke was met with silence.
